docs.snippet: Does homework cause stress and tension in your family? Or does it create opportunities to work together with your parents or siblings?

headline.print_headline: Do Teachers Assign Too Much Homework?
headline.main: Do Teachers Assign Too Much Homework?

docs.snippet: Italy's La Scala opera house says soprano Daniela Dessi has died. She was 59.

headline.print_headline: Italian Soprano Daniela Dessi Dies at 59 After Brief Illness
headline.main: Italian Soprano Daniela Dessi Dies at 59 After Brief Illness

docs.snippet: For some, there was a realization that the tech industry’s relationship with government — and the public — is likely to shift in a fundamental way.

headline.print_headline: In Trump, Tech Leaders Fear Challenge to Vision
headline.main: Silicon Valley Reels After Trump’s Election

docs.snippet: The Czech interior ministry has set up a unit to counter what it sees as propaganda from Russia and elsewhere that has been affecting public opinion in the European Union and NATO member nation, Interior Minister Milan Chovanec said on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Czechs Set Up Unit to Counter Perceived Propaganda Threat From Russia
headline.main: Czechs Set Up Unit to Counter Perceived Propaganda Threat From Russia

docs.snippet: Nguyen Ngoc Nhu Quynh, a co-founder of the Network of Vietnamese Bloggers, has challenged leaders over topics including a dump of toxic chemicals.

headline.main: Vietnam Arrests Mother Mushroom, a Top Blogger, for Criticizing Government

docs.snippet: Journalists from Hungary's main leftist daily Nepszabadsag published their work on Thursday in Budapest's street newspaper sold by homeless people, seeking to keep the paper alive after it was shut by its owner this month.

headline.print_headline: Hungarian Paper Published in Homeless Magazine in Defiance of Government After Shut Down
headline.main: Hungarian Paper Published in Homeless Magazine in Defiance of Government After Shut Down

docs.snippet: Signal, an encrypted chat service, is a must in an era when companies collect ever more information about users and government surveillance may expand.

headline.print_headline: For Online Privacy, Signal Stands Out
headline.main: Worried About the Privacy of Your Messages? Download Signal

docs.snippet: A man from Topeka, Kansas, on Tuesday was sentenced to 15 months in federal prison for helping a would-be jihadist's unsuccessful plot to bomb a U.S. military base, prosecutors said.

headline.print_headline: Kansas Man Sentenced for Foiled Plot to Bomb U.S. Military Base
headline.main: Kansas Man Sentenced for Foiled Plot to Bomb U.S. Military Base

docs.snippet: Hot dogs, or at least the name, will soon be off the menu for a U.S. fast food chain selling the popular snack in Malaysia.

headline.print_headline: US Fast Food Chain in Malaysia Told to Change Hot Dog Name
headline.main: US Fast Food Chain in Malaysia Told to Change Hot Dog Name

docs.snippet: The documentary, broadcast on a network owned by the Qatari government, accuses Egypt of abusing its recruits, and the country was quick to denounce it.

headline.main: Al Jazeera Film Critical of Egyptian Army Strains Egypt-Qatar Ties Further
